Header: Wittenburg wins gold at the Wind Games indoor skydiving championships
Content: Kaleigh Wittenburg of the U.S. was one of the winners at the Wind Games indoor skydiving competition in Girona. The 14-year-old took top honours in the Freestyle Open category in the Empuriabrava Wind Tunnel, where entrants show off their acrobatic skills in front of a packed crowd. Among the other winners were Windoor DC, the Spanish pair Cesar Rico and Dani Gallego, who took top place in the 2 Way Dynamic category and the Belgian team The Fantastic4 who won the four person version.
